title: Pt 1 - 3 tips to make your homesteading self-sufficient lifestyle successful while staying debt free

tasks.task: Observing the property before making changes
subtasks: Walking the property at least once a week for a year
Marking notable features on paper or using GPS
Recording observations to inform future planning

tasks.task: Creating a budget and timeline for homesteading projects
subtasks: Estimating costs for various homesteading aspects (e.g., chicken coops, rabbit hutches, fencing)
Allocating funds annually while considering debt repayment
Adjusting timelines to account for unexpected delays and problem-solving

tasks.task: Planning for a source of income during the homesteading transition
subtasks: Continuing employment while engaging in homesteading activities
Prioritizing cash-based homesteading over immediate debt repayment
Allocating budgeted amounts toward homesteading projects and debt reduction

tasks.task: Taking a year to observe the property to avoid damaging natural resources
subtasks: Identifying edible plants and wildlife during the yearlong observation period
Including "natural" sources in homestead plans to avoid destruction

tasks.task: Emphasizing the importance of patience and careful planning
subtasks: Using a spreadsheet to track goals and expenses
Understanding that homesteading is expensive and requires a measured approach
Prioritizing cheaper alternatives like rabbit hutches over more expensive options (e.g., chicken coops)
Considering the implications of different animal choices on expenses and production
